intro: Tylophora paniculata, commonly known as the Chinese bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its attractive, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth surface, while its stems are woody and often branched. Tylophora paniculata is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional Chinese medicine.
